storyTitle: As System Administrator, I want to monitor integration error logs to achieve proactive issue resolution

testCases.title: Verify centralized aggregation of integration error logs
preconditions: Administrator has valid credentials and access to monitoring dashboard
Test environment is configured with integration components
Error log aggregation service is running and operational
Database is accessible and has sufficient storage capacity

steps.action: Generate integration errors in test environment by simulating various failure scenarios (API timeout, database connection failure, authentication error)
steps.expectedResult: Errors are logged by respective integration components and sent to the centralized aggregation service with complete details including timestamp, error type, severity, and source component

steps.action: Open web browser and navigate to the monitoring dashboard URL
steps.expectedResult: Monitoring dashboard login page is displayed

steps.action: Enter valid administrator credentials and click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Administrator is successfully authenticated and redirected to the main monitoring dashboard

steps.action: Access the error logs section of the monitoring dashboard
steps.expectedResult: All generated errors are displayed in the dashboard with correct details including error type, timestamp, severity level, source component, and error message

steps.action: Verify that error count matches the number of errors generated in step 1
steps.expectedResult: Error count is accurate and all generated errors are present in the dashboard

steps.action: Apply filter by selecting specific error type from the filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard refreshes and displays only errors matching the selected error type

steps.action: Clear the error type filter and apply date range filter for today's date
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays only errors that occurred within the selected date range with accurate timestamps

steps.action: Apply combined filters for error type and date range simultaneously
steps.expectedResult: Filtered results match both criteria accurately, showing only errors of the specified type within the specified date range

postconditions: All integration errors are successfully aggregated and visible in the dashboard
Error logs remain persisted in the system for future reference
Administrator session remains active for further testing

testCases.title: Test real-time alerting on critical errors
preconditions: Administrator has valid credentials and access to monitoring dashboard
Alert notification service is configured and operational
Administrator contact information (email/SMS) is configured in the system
Test environment is set up to simulate critical integration errors
System clock is synchronized for accurate timestamp verification

steps.action: Note the current system time before triggering the error
steps.expectedResult: Current timestamp is recorded for alert delivery time verification

steps.action: Trigger a critical integration error in the test environment (e.g., simulate complete database connection failure)
steps.expectedResult: Critical error is detected by the monitoring system and logged with severity level marked as 'Critical'

steps.action: Check configured administrator email inbox and SMS messages
steps.expectedResult: Alert notification is received via both email and SMS within 1 minute of error occurrence, containing error details, timestamp, severity, and affected component

steps.action: Verify the alert delivery timestamp against the error occurrence time
steps.expectedResult: Time difference between error occurrence and alert delivery is less than or equal to 1 minute

steps.action: Log into the monitoring dashboard and navigate to the alerts section
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard displays the triggered critical alert with status 'Unacknowledged'

steps.action: Click on the alert and select 'Acknowledge' button
steps.expectedResult: Alert status is updated to 'Acknowledged', acknowledgment timestamp is recorded, and administrator username is logged

steps.action: Navigate to the alert history section in the dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Alert history displays the complete lifecycle of the alert including trigger time, delivery time, acknowledgment time, and administrator who acknowledged it

steps.action: Verify alert resolution tracking by updating the alert status to 'Resolved' with resolution notes
steps.expectedResult: Alert status is updated to 'Resolved', resolution timestamp is recorded, resolution notes are saved, and complete audit trail is maintained

postconditions: Alert is acknowledged and tracked in the system
Complete alert history is maintained for audit purposes
Alert notification channels remain configured for future alerts
Error log entry is linked to the alert record

testCases.title: Validate export functionality of error logs
preconditions: Administrator has valid credentials and access to monitoring dashboard
Error logs are present in the system with various error types and severities
Browser download settings allow file downloads
Administrator has appropriate permissions to export error logs
CSV and JSON export functionality is enabled in the system

steps.action: Log into the monitoring dashboard with administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Administrator is successfully authenticated and dashboard is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the error logs section and apply filters to select specific error logs (e.g., errors from the last 24 hours)
steps.expectedResult: Filtered error logs are displayed matching the selected criteria

steps.action: Select multiple error log entries using checkboxes or select all option
steps.expectedResult: Selected error logs are highlighted and selection count is displayed

steps.action: Click on the 'Export' button in the dashboard toolbar
steps.expectedResult: Export options dialog is displayed showing available formats: CSV and JSON

steps.action: Select 'CSV' format from the export options and click 'Download' button
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is generated and download begins automatically with filename containing timestamp (e.g., error_logs_2024-01-15.csv)

steps.action: Open the downloaded CSV file using spreadsheet application (Excel or similar)
steps.expectedResult: CSV file opens successfully and contains all selected error logs with correct data in columns including timestamp, error type, severity, source component, error message, and status

steps.action: Verify data integrity by comparing a sample of CSV entries with dashboard display
steps.expectedResult: Data in CSV file matches exactly with the data displayed in the dashboard for the selected error logs

steps.action: Return to the dashboard and click 'Export' button again, this time selecting 'JSON' format
steps.expectedResult: JSON export option is selected and download button is enabled

steps.action: Click 'Download' button to export in JSON format
steps.expectedResult: JSON file is generated and download begins automatically with filename containing timestamp (e.g., error_logs_2024-01-15.json)

steps.action: Open the downloaded JSON file using text editor or JSON viewer
steps.expectedResult: JSON file opens successfully and contains properly structured JSON array with all selected error logs

steps.action: Validate JSON structure and verify it contains all required fields: id, timestamp, errorType, severity, sourceComponent, errorMessage, status
steps.expectedResult: JSON structure is valid and well-formed, containing all required fields with correct data types and values matching the dashboard display

steps.action: Verify data integrity by comparing JSON entries with dashboard display
steps.expectedResult: Data in JSON file matches exactly with the data displayed in the dashboard for the selected error logs

postconditions: CSV and JSON files are successfully downloaded to local system
Exported files contain accurate and complete error log data
Original error logs remain unchanged in the system
Export activity is logged in the system audit trail

storyTitle: As System Administrator, I want to receive real-time alerts on integration failures to achieve rapid response

testCases.title: Verify alert triggering on critical integration failure
preconditions: System Administrator account is created with valid credentials
Alert notification service is running and operational
Administrator email address and SMS number are configured in the system
Email and SMS delivery services are accessible and functional
Integration monitoring service is active and monitoring all integration points
Test environment is configured to simulate critical integration failures

steps.action: Record the current system timestamp before simulating the failure
steps.expectedResult: Current timestamp is noted for calculating alert delivery time

steps.action: Simulate a critical integration failure in the test environment (e.g., force shutdown of critical integration service or database connection)
steps.expectedResult: Integration monitoring service detects the critical failure and logs it with severity level 'Critical'

steps.action: Verify that alert is triggered automatically by checking system logs
steps.expectedResult: Alert trigger event is logged in the system with timestamp, failure type, and affected integration component

steps.action: Check the configured administrator email inbox for alert notification
steps.expectedResult: Email alert is received containing failure details, timestamp, severity level, affected component, and recommended actions

steps.action: Check the configured administrator mobile phone for SMS alert
steps.expectedResult: SMS alert is received containing concise failure information including severity, component name, and timestamp

steps.action: Calculate the time difference between failure occurrence and alert receipt
steps.expectedResult: Both email and SMS alerts are received within 1 minute of the critical integration failure occurrence

steps.action: Log into the system dashboard using administrator credentials
steps.expectedResult: Administrator is successfully authenticated and dashboard loads displaying active alerts

steps.action: Navigate to the alerts section and locate the triggered alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert is displayed in the alerts list with status 'Active' or 'Unacknowledged', showing all failure details

steps.action: Click on the alert to view full details and click 'Acknowledge' button
steps.expectedResult: Alert details page opens showing complete failure information, timeline, and acknowledgment option

steps.action: Submit the acknowledgment with optional notes
steps.expectedResult: Alert status changes to 'Acknowledged', acknowledgment timestamp is recorded, administrator name is logged, and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Verify acknowledgment is logged by checking alert history
steps.expectedResult: Alert history shows acknowledgment entry with timestamp, administrator name, and any notes provided

postconditions: Alert is successfully triggered and delivered via all configured channels
Alert is acknowledged and logged in the system
Alert delivery and acknowledgment records are maintained for audit
Integration failure remains logged for further investigation

testCases.title: Test alert configuration UI functionality
preconditions: Administrator has valid credentials with permissions to configure alerts
Alert configuration module is deployed and accessible
At least one alert contact is already configured in the system
Test email address and SMS number are available for configuration testing
Integration monitoring service is running to trigger test alerts

steps.action: Open web browser and navigate to the system dashboard URL
steps.expectedResult: System login page is displayed

steps.action: Enter administrator credentials and click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Administrator is authenticated successfully and redirected to the main dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to Settings or Configuration menu and select 'Alert Configuration' option
steps.expectedResult: Alert configuration UI loads displaying current alert settings including existing contacts, channels, and escalation rules

steps.action: Review the current alert configuration settings displayed in the UI
steps.expectedResult: UI displays all current settings including contact list, enabled channels (email/SMS), escalation rules, and alert thresholds in an organized and readable format

steps.action: Click 'Add Contact' or 'Edit Contacts' button to modify alert contacts
steps.expectedResult: Contact management interface opens showing existing contacts with options to add, edit, or remove

steps.action: Add a new contact by entering name, email address, and SMS number, then click 'Save'
steps.expectedResult: New contact is added to the contact list and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Modify an existing contact's email address and save the changes
steps.expectedResult: Contact information is updated successfully and changes are reflected in the contact list

steps.action: Navigate to escalation rules section and modify the escalation time threshold (e.g., change from 5 minutes to 10 minutes)
steps.expectedResult: Escalation rule configuration interface allows modification and displays current rules clearly

steps.action: Add a new escalation level by specifying time threshold and escalation contacts, then save
steps.expectedResult: New escalation rule is added successfully, saved to the system, and displayed in the escalation rules list

steps.action: Click 'Save Configuration' or 'Apply Changes' button to save all modifications
steps.expectedResult: All configuration changes are saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and UI shows updated settings

steps.action: Verify changes are persisted by logging out and logging back in, then accessing alert configuration
steps.expectedResult: All previously saved changes are retained and displayed correctly in the alert configuration UI

steps.action: Trigger a test alert by simulating an integration failure or using 'Send Test Alert' function if available
steps.expectedResult: Test alert is generated by the system

steps.action: Check that alert is sent to the newly configured contacts via email
steps.expectedResult: Email alert is received by the newly added contact email address with correct alert content

steps.action: Check that alert is sent to the newly configured contacts via SMS
steps.expectedResult: SMS alert is received by the newly added contact phone number with correct alert content

steps.action: Verify that updated escalation rules are applied by checking alert escalation behavior
steps.expectedResult: Alert follows the new escalation rules with correct time thresholds and escalation contacts

postconditions: Alert configuration is updated with new contacts and escalation rules
Configuration changes are persisted in the database
Test alerts are successfully delivered to updated contacts
System is ready to send alerts using the new configuration for actual failures
